newsitem.title: GERMANY: German multimedia companies form watchdog group.
newsitem.headline: German multimedia companies form watchdog group.

text.p: A dozen top companies in the German multimedia industry said Thursday they had formed their own watchdog organisation to keep their Internet services free of content considered indecent or illegal.
The new group, Voluntary Self-Regulation of Multimedia Services (FSM) includes Microsoft Corp., ProSieben Media AG and Deutsche Telekom AG.
It said in a statement it hoped in particular to fight political extremism on the Internet.

"The FSM is an alliance of associations and companies in the multimedia industry with the goal of protecting the interests of users and the public, especially in terms of race discrimination and the glorification of violence," it said.
The members agreed to a code of cyberspace content and will open an office in Wiesbaden on Aug. 1, which will accept complaints from the public about the Internet or online services, the FSM said.
Detlev Mueller-Using of Deutsche Telekom will serve as the group's first chairman.
